review: If you have any of the following and use them often:Netflix, Hulu, HBO GoPositives: Cheap, easy to use, multiplatform (iOS, android, windows, mac)I am not ashamed to say that I have bought 6 of them and last Christmas gave them out to my friends and family. They make amazing stocking stuffers. Chromecast at this stage are only going to get better. They recently have released their SDK software out and developer of apps will hopefully soon make their apps compatible.One of the few negatives I have with it is that streaming video from my laptop is pretty difficult at this point. I can do it if it's an mp4 (through chrome) or if I use plex but I want to be able to do it for all my videos without having to go a third party app. I think this will be quickly fixed by the end of this year when some enterprising developer will figure it out.

review: I really love this product for the price and it is really easy to use (Trust me if I can use it, anyone can!) I bought it for a retirement gift for a friend who loved it and I bought it for a Valentine's Day gift for my husband (he doesn't have to know it was only $35) We play photo slide shows on our 60" TV and can really see the photos at that size.  I like watching You tube videos on it and also easily play Netflix movies from my phone or computer with it.  Another thing we do is have battles, yes battles with it.  My husband will put up a photo and I'll one-up it with a better photo or you-tube video.  My one hope is that someone comes up with an app to play videos using this awesome tool.
